safety_risk.safety_principle: 9. Improper Chemical/Medicine Storage (Child Access): Store all medicines, cleaning agents, cosmetics, pesticides, and chemicals separately from children's items (e.g., toys) and food.
safety_risk.edition_plan: Add a standard-sized, brightly colored spray bottle of all-purpose cleaner, with a blue liquid visible through a clear plastic bottle, and place it inside the open blue toy bin. The bottle should be positioned among the existing toys, with its spray nozzle and top portion clearly visible above the other items, making it look as though it was carelessly tossed in and is easily accessible.
hazard_related_area: the cleaning fluid bottle

safety_risk.safety_principle: 3. Damaged Furniture: Repair broken furniture instantly to avoid harm to users.
safety_risk.edition_plan: Modify the front-right leg of the dark wood coffee table to have a large, visible, vertical splintered crack running from the top joint down to the curve of the leg. The crack should be wide enough to suggest the leg is structurally compromised and could collapse if any weight is put on the table.
hazard_related_area: the cracked leg of the wooden coffee table
safety_risk.fidelity_check: REJECTED: [Distortion] - The left front leg of the coffee table exhibits unnatural stretching and deformation, violating structural integrity (Distortion).

safety_risk.safety_principle: 7. Damaged Electrical Cords
safety_risk.edition_plan: Modify the existing dual light switch plate to show signs of severe electrical damage. Add several spiderweb-style cracks across the white plastic plate, especially around the screws. Add dark brown and black sooty scorch marks on the wall immediately surrounding the taped-up right-hand switch, suggesting it has overheated or short-circuited. Make the black tape appear slightly melted and peeling at the edges, failing to conceal the broken switch underneath. This creates a clear and immediate fire and electrocution hazard.
hazard_related_area: damaged light switch
cracked switch plate
scorch marks
safety_risk.hazard_check: REJECTED: Add a visibly damaged electrical cord (e.g., frayed insulation with exposed wires) connected to the outlet. Position it where the damage creates clear risk conditions (e.g., cord lying in water puddle, or damaged section touching metal conduit). Ensure the cord damage is unambiguous and central to the hazard narrative.
